alert.note: Alert for Ashe; Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 9:20PM EST until January 20 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph resulting in blowing and drifting snow. Wind chills of 10 to 20 degrees below zero. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Ashe and Watauga Counties. In Virginia, Smyth and Grayson counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Drifting snow may recovered previously cleared roads. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could result in hypothermia and frostbite if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sub-zero wind chills are expected again Saturday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you venture outdoors, please wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
